I think "Wilde" might be a great fit for you! Since you're intrigued by its title, I'll recommend two movies from the list that capture the essence of Wilde's tone and style.

Firstly, if you enjoy dark, edgy themes with a touch of rebellion, I highly recommend "Fight Club". Brad Pitt stars alongside Edward Norton in this cult classic about an underground fight club that explores toxic masculinity. The movie's gritty tone and thought-provoking commentary will likely resonate with you.

Secondly, if you're in the mood for something more lighthearted yet still clever and witty, I suggest "What Women Want". Who wouldn't want to get a glimpse into what women are thinking? This 2000 comedy stars Mel Gibson as an advertising executive who acquires this peculiar ability. It's a fun, fish-out-of-water story with plenty of humor and charm.

Let me know if you'd like more recommendations or have any questions about these movies!
